result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel E Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False emergency 9-1-1 call (2+ w/in 4 years), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 256.35(10)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 1 day sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Daniel E Johnson in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.




Court orders the following:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
1 Day Credit - If Revoked.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  21 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  
 
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
For the 03/14/16 court date.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel E Johnson
Current: 445 madison St, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 03-15-2016)
Prior: 415 W Park Ave,#2, Waukesha, WI 53186
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.

CONDITIONS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant not to use 9-1-1 unless in an emergency.  
Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  
Defendants who can not pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.
